sources.title: Show of Shows (1929) MUSICAL REVUEüçï M.C. FRANK FAY
sources.description:
PizzaFLIX Presents CLASSIC MOVIE MONDAY
Host: Frank Fay
Stars: John Barrymore, Myrna Loy, Rin Tin Tin, Loretta Young, and more!
Directed by John Adolfi
Warner Brothers' answer to the all-star, all-talking, all-singing, all-dancing' craze of 1929! Hosted by Frank Fay, this dazzling revue showcases the studio‚Äôs brightest stars, including John Barrymore, Myrna Loy, Chester Morris, Dolores Costello, Rin Tin Tin, and Many, Many More! 
üçïCHAPTERSüçï
0:00          PizzaFLIX Intro
0:53          MAIN TITLES:  Show of Shows
01:22       PROLOGUE:  William Courtenay, Hobart Bosworth, and H.B. Warner
02:31       MILITARY MARCH:  Monte Blue
07:10       FRANK FAY SKIT
09:14       WHAT'S BECOME OF THE FLORADORA BOYS? Alice Day, Lila Lee, Myrna Loy, and MORE
15:05       $20 BET: Frank Fay, Chester Morris, Jack Mulhall
18:34      MOTION PICTURE PIRATES:  Ted Lewis, Noah Beery, and Tully Marshall
27:20       IF I COULD LEARN TO LOVE: Georges Carpentier, Pasty Ruth Miller, Alice White
33:23       DEAR LITTLE PUP:  Performed by Frank Fay
34:25      PING PONGO:  Performed by Winnie Lightner
36:28      THE ONLY SONG I KNOW:  Performed by Nick Lucas
40:05      FRANK FAY SKIT:  with Rin Tin Tin
40:55      RECITATIONS:  Featuring Beatrice Lillie, Louise Fazenda, Lloyd Hamilton, and Frank Fay
49:34      MEET MY SISTER: Hollywood sisters
58:14      SINGIN' IN THE BATHTUB: Winnie Lightner's send-up to "Singin' in the Rain"
1:02:20   JACK BUCHANAN WITH THE GLEE QUARTET: Restored deleted skit 
1:07:54   JUST AN HOUR OF LOVE: Performed by Ir√®ne Bordoni, Harry Akst
1:13:14   CHINESE FANTASY: Rin Tin Tin, Nick Lucas, and Myrna Loy in TECHNICOLOR!
1:21:36   FRANK FAY WITH SID SILVERS
1:25:36   A BICYCLE BUILT FOR TWO: Chester Conklin, Douglas Fairbanks Jr, Chester Morris
1:29:30   IF YOUR BEST FRIEND WON'T TELL YOU (WHY SHOULD I?) Sid Silvers, Frank Fay
1:32:24   LARRY CEBALLOS' BLACK AND WHITE GIRLS: Sid Silvers, Louis Fazenda
1:37:25   YOUR LOVE IS ALL I CRAVE: Frank Fay, Harry Akst
1:44:51   KING RICHARD III (IN EXCERPT FROM ‚ÄúHENRY IV‚Äù, PART III) John Barrymore
1:51:51   MEXICAN MOONSHINE: Monte Blue, Frank Fay,  Lloyd Hamilton, Noah Beery
1:56:06   LADY LUCK: Alexander Gray, Betty Compson, Warner Bros. Ensemble

Are you a PizzaFLIX Fanatic? Join our exclusive Fan Club for dedicated Classic movie lovers: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCE34fwgW7kWr7tc7YiOWtRw/join

metadata.Plot: It's 1929. The studio gave the cinema its voice and offered the audiences a chance to see their favorite actors and actresses from the silent screen era. For the first time, they can be heard in a gaudy, grandiose music comedy revue. But also appearing are actors and actresses from the first 'talkies', stars from Broadway, and, of course, the German shepherd Rin-Tin-Tin. Frank Fay is the host of the more than 70 well-known stars who show various acts.
metadata.Writer: J. Keirn Brennan, Frank Fay, William Shakespeare
metadata.Actors: Frank Fay, William Courtenay, H.B. Warner
